loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Diosdado has a bakeshop that sells breads and pastries. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries.

Diosdado has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña María vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, sus hijos estudian en una escuela de su comunidad, ella tiene su casa en un barrio de San Lorenzo, Honduras, Doña María tiene su negocio en su vivienda.
El negocio de Doña María es la venta de frescos, enchiladas, tacos, baliadas, y algunos productos de consumo diario.
Doña María Esta solicitando 8,000.00 lempiras dinero que desea invertir en la compra de verduras, frescos de botella, carnes, lactaos y jugos.
Con las utilidades desea seguir abasteciendo su negocio para hacerlo cada día más fuerte, ya que desea seguir teniendo el financiamiento de PRISMA para que su negocio vaya creciendo.
El sueño de María es que su negocio crezca y sea el mejor de la zona en donde ella vive  para darle una mejor vida a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña María lives with her husband and two children.  Her children study in an elementary school in the community.  Their home is in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  Doña María has her business in her home, where she sells drinks, enchiladas, tacos, baliadas [tortillas folded in half and filled with refried beans], and some products for daily use.  Doña María is requesting 8,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of vegetables, bottled drinks, meat, dairy products, and juice.  She wants to keep stocking her business to make it stronger every day.  She hopes to keep having financing from Prisma so her business will keep growing.  María's dream is to grow her business and have it be the best in the area where she lives so she can give her family a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2012

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 39-year-old lady who is married and has four children, Sardi, 21 and Alfa, 19, who graduated from Senior High School; Dominggus, who is attending 2nd grade of Junior High School, and Nikson who is 3 years old.

Yuliana runs a weaving shawl business. She usually produces 50 shawls in a month since she has regular customer who often come to buy the shawls directly to be resold at the art shop. In addition, Yuliana sometimes spends her spare time planting vegetables at their farm with her husband.
 
In order to meet her customer demands, Yuliana requested a loan from TLM for IDR 4,000,000 to purchase knitting yarn for her shawl business and seedlings for their farm.

loans.use: to purchase knitting yarn for her shawl business and seedlings for their farm.

loans.name: Nanus

texts.en: Nanus, a 30-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, lives in Yei where she has been operating a food stall for five years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is requesting her first loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and beans to sell. Nanus will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mahtovbi

texts.ru: Махтовби жительница района Хамадони. Она портниха. Ей 41 год. Махтовби более 23 лет занимается шитьем. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mahtovbi is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  She is a seamstress.  She is 41 years old.  Mahtovbi has been involved in sewing for over 23 years.  She has four children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret, a 50-year-old mother of six children between 10 and 25 years of age, lives in Migori and is married to Joshua. She has been selling cereals, mainly maize cereal, for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.

Margret is now requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of maize cereal, the profits from which she will use to repay the loan. Her dream is to increase her stock of maize.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, age 33, is a farmer in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She and her husband have two children. She has been involved in growing and harvesting crops for over 20 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who manufactures tables, beds, chairs, and other furniture items. He earns about USD 4 per day.

In order to improve her family’s standard of living, Oun is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase cattle, which she intends to fatten and sell at market. 

In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide more convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and sell at market

loans.name: Basarbu

texts.ru:
Басарбу 57 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей.  Басарбу на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Басарбу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова, 3 теленка, 10 овец, 2 лошади, 15 коз и 15 козлят. Также семья Басарбу ежегодно обрабатывает  1,60 га земли, где выращивает кукурузу, клевер и картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Басарбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят и овец - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Басарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение деятельности.
texts.en: Basarbu is 57 years old, married and has six children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 30 years, after starting this business with an mount of 8,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Basarbu's hard work, her business now contains one cow, three calves, ten sheep, two horses, fifteen goats and fifteen goat kids.  Basarbu's family also annually works on 1.60 hectares of land, where they grow corn, clover and potatoes.  In order to further develop her business, Basarbu requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves and lambs.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Savlatbi

texts.ru: Савлатби более десяти лет занимается торговлей. Она замужем. Ей 43 года. У нее двое детей. В основном она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кредит берет для приобретения весенней детской одежды.
texts.en: Savlatbi has been involved in sales for over ten years.  She 43 years old, married and has two children.  She is primarily involved in selling children's clothing.  Savlatbi is requesting this loan to purchase spring children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase spring children's clothing

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cheryl is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Klowng

texts.en:
Klowng is 33 years old. She is married to her spouse and is blessed with two school-age children. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and help her children get a good education. She wants them to become knowledgeable, so they may have good jobs in the future without working in a type of physical work as she does. She’s a humble rice farmer and, in addition, she works as a sewing staff member for a garment factory and normally gets her salary monthly. She has been in this business since 2008. 

She would like to borrow a .loan to buy cows to keep for the maintenance on her farm. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has a strong determination to uplift their status of living and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Srey Oun

texts.en:
Srey Oun, age 30, has been working in a garment factory for over five years, earning about USD 3 per day. She and her husband live in Takeo Province with their two children. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the increased numbers of tourists in Cambodia, Srey Oun is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 1200 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband, which he will use to provide public transportation service for tourists. This purchase will enable her husband to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a flat in Phnom Penh and to help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband, which he will use to provide public transportation service for tourists

loans.name: Francis Yanett

texts.es:
Doña Francis de 46 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos, ella vive con su conyugue el señor Nilsi quien es comerciante y le ayuda a vender ambulante en una carreta las golosinas, sus hijos van a la escuela y el mayor le ayuda en su negocio, ella vive en San Lorenzo, Honduras.
Dona Francis Tiene un pequeño negocio  en la afueras del mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, Ella vende artículos de achinería como ganchos para ropa, fajas, sandalias, bóxer, brasieres, calcetines y mucho mas, en su casa también ella prepara chicharrones de cerdos, frijoles en bolsa y tortillas. 
Necesita el préstamo para compra de producto para abastecer el negocio de achinería y comprar sandalias que son las que se venden en época de verano.
Doña Francis desea seguir teniendo más créditos con PRISMA ya que con las ganancias desea mejorar su casa y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Su sueño es ampliar más su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Francis is 46 and is the mother of four children.  She lives with her husband, Nilsi, who works as a street vendor selling candy.  Their children go to school, and the oldest one helps her with her business.  She lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  Francis has a small business on the outskirts of the new market of San Lorenzo.  She sells low-cost merchandise like clothes hangers, belts, sandals, boxers, bras, socks, and much more.  She also makes chicharrones (friend pork skins), beans, and tortillas in her home.  She needs this loan to buy products to stock her merchandise and to buy sandals, which are what sells in the summer season.  Francis hopes to keep having more loans with Prisma since with her earnings, she hopes to improve her home and have a better quality of life.  Her dream is to expand her business more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2012

loans.use: to buy underwear and personal use items for her business.

loans.name: Hâm

texts.en:
Hâm, age 52, is a hardworking and intelligent woman. She and her husband are raising four children at home, and they also have two grown children who are married and living with their own families around the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

For over 20 years she has been engaged in an agricultural business, cultivating rice within the rainy season of the year. She is trying to expand her business so that she may improve her family's overall well-being. 

She would like to receive her third cycle loan from HKL in order to purchase construction supplies to renovate the old house in which the family resides. She hopes that her loan will be approved and she thanks you in advance for your generosity and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to renovate the old house in which her family lives

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 42, lives in Migori County. She and her husband Maurice have five children who are enrolled in school.

Mary operates a clothes-selling business, a business she has operated for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 4,200. Mary is taking out her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan funds to buy a stock of clothes to offer for sale. 

Her profits will be used to ensure the education of her children. Their further education is her primary aspiration.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng, a 48-year-old farmer living in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City, is married to 48-year-old Mr. Nov, a rice farmer and local fisherman. This couple works together in the farming business and has six single children, two of whom are employed as construction workers and help their parents meet the needs of the family.

Due to the dry season coming, Mrs. Sreng does not have enough funds for planting and so is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and a few fishing tools to help her husband catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seed and a few fishing tools for her husband.

loans.name: Nereo

texts.es: Nereo de 38 años de edad es soltero, labora para la municipalidad como maestro de obra desde hace 3½ años. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de constrir un cuarto en su casa y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida familiar. Cabe señalar que Nereo con el credito anterior logro comprar una parte de los materiales para la construccion que ahora quiere hacer.
texts.en: Nereo is 38 years old. He is single and has worked for the city as a builder for 3 1/2 years. He is asking for his 2nd loan with the objective of building a room in his house and thus have better living conditions for his family. It is worth noting that with the previous loan he was able to buy some of the materials for the construction that he is about to do.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Griseld

texts.es: Griselda de 39 años de edad vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena,  ciudad  localizada a orillas del mar Caribe y  segundo centro urbano en importancia de la Costa Caribe colombiana, después de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Griselda es una mujer comerciante que inició su negocio, apoyada por su padre quien le mandó productos de papelería para la venta con los que le fue muy bien y gradualmente ella ha ido agregando la línea de ropa y calzado, con las cuales ha diversificado sus líneas de producto y expandido su mercado, visitando empresas y captando la atención de empleados que hoy son sus principales clientes, a quienes des da crédito por la compra de sus productos y ellos le pagan en partidas quincenales o mensuales, de acuerdo el plazo acordado con cada uno. Griselda hace un año ingreso a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y recibió su primer financiamiento, con el que logró aumentar su negocio, porque incrementó su capacidad de compra y con ello el reconocimiento de sus clientes. Hoy quiere continuar con este esquema y está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual surtirá su negocio con la compra de accesorios femeninos , calzado y ropa, que ya tiene encargada por sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante es tener una boutique en algún centro comercial famoso de la ciudad, pero su gran desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para lograrlo. Con su inversión logrará responder oportunamente a su clientela y aumentar un poco mas su capital de trabajo pues tiene una gran aceptación en el mercado y esta es justamente una condición de éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Griselda is 39, and lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena, located on the shores of the Caribbean. It is the second most important urban center on the Colombian Caribbean Coast, after the city of Barranquilla.

Griselda is a businesswoman who started her business supported by her father, who sent her stationery products to sell. It has gone very well, and gradually she has been adding the line of clothing and footwear. In this way she has diversified her product lines and expanded her market, visiting companies and attracting the attention of employees, who are today her main customers. 

She extends them credit for the purchase of her products and they pay her back in bi-weekly or monthly installments, in accordance with the terms agreed upon in each case.

Griselda joined the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a year ago, and received her first loan, through which she succeeded in increasing her business, because she increased her purchasing capacity and customer approval. Now she wants to continue with this plan, and is applying for her credikiva loan, which she will use to stock her business with women's accessories, footwear and clothing, that has already been ordered by her customers.

Her goal is to someday have a boutique in some well known shopping center in the city, but her great challenge is the insufficient working capital she has for achieving this. With her investment, she will succeed in responding to her customers appropriately, and increase her working capital a bit more. Her  business is very popular in the market, and this is exactly what is needed for future success.

loans.use: To buy women's accessories, footwear and clothing.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael de 25 años de edad es soltero, labora para la municipalidad como ayudante de albañil desde hace 3½ años. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de terminar la construccion de un cuarto en su casa y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida familiar. Cabe señalar que a pesar de ser muy joven es muy trabajador, y con el credito anterior compro una parte de los materiales para la construccion de su cuarto y en este momento desea llevar a cabo la obra, ademas como el sabe de construccion le va a salir mas barato porque se ahorrara un poco la mano de obra.
texts.en: Misael is 25 and single.  He has worked for the city as an assistant bricklayer for 3 1/2 years.  He is requesting his third loan with the objective of finishing a room on his home so his family will have better living conditions.  It's fitting to point out that despite being very young, he is very hard-working.  With his previous loan, he bought part of the materials to construct the room, and now he hopes to complete the project.  He also knows that the construction will be cheaper now because he will save some on the labor.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over 4 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns approximately USD 7 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Phen wants to run an additional business. 

With this goal in mind, Phen is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fish to breed in order to resell them when they gain weight. This loan would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to breed in order to resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Resin

texts.en:
Resin is thirty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Resin provides motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She also makes and sells candles in different sizes. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy gasoline for the motorela services and the materials she needs to make candles. 

Resin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Resin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for the motorela service and the materials she needs to make candles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is fifty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Esther has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for twenty years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Esther has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Esther hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a thirty-five-year-old man from Migori. He is married to Milka and they have two children aged between two and seven.

Paul owns a retail shop. He has been running this kind of business for the last six years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is now taking a second loan which he will use to buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat.

His profits will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to have a big retail shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia lives in Yei. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Sadia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and beans to sell.

loans.name: Phait

texts.en:
Phet, twenty-eight, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding poultry for over six years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who approximately earns USD 6 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Phet is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his construction work. This purchase will enable her husband to get enough tools to use in his work. In the future, she would like to help her children get bachelor’s degrees and build fence around the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her husband to use in his construction work.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 38 years old and married with 4 children.  With all her children in school, Rachel works very hard to provide for them.

Rachel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Rachel has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soap, soft-drinks and beverages. 

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is forty-three years old and one of her children is in school.

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Susana has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

Myrna has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Mary, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in farming for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy keeping.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida, age 39, earns her income from selling charcoal. She and her husband live in Yei with their three children, all of whom are still in school. She has been engaged in her business for five years.

Faida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this will be her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 500 in order to purchase charcoal to offer for sale.

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 35, lives in Yei. She sells clothes, and has been in this business for four years. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are still in school. 

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 500 in order to purchase clothes to offer for sale.

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her rice mill.

Evelyn has been in this business for twenty-two years. Evelyn earns additional income from food vending and a general store.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to have a lumber yard in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her rice mill.

loans.name: Deomida

texts.en:
Deomida, age 64, runs a sari-sari (general store) business in Talibon, Bohol. She has operated her business for three years. Her husband works as a farmer.

Deomida sells various items in her store, such as bread, soy sauce, vinegar, detergent soap, and canned goods. She is happy that she is contributing to her family's earnings with her income from the store and does her best to help sustain her family. 

She has requested a loan in  order to buy more items to offer for sale, such as canned goods, toiletries, and soft drinks. Deomida has high hopes for the continued growth of her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to buy more items to offer for sale in her store, such as canned goods, toiletries, and soft drinks

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 47, is married. She resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over 10 years, earning approximately USD $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who approximately earns USD $3 per day. 

Due to difficulty with the family’s transportation, Pov is requesting a loan of USD $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sothim

texts.en:
Sothim, 30, is married. She resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over five years, earning approximately USD $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who approximately earns USD $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sothim is requesting a loan of USD $500 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store, build a new house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more profit to support the family.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquin nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 50 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él es maderero y tiene una moto sierra con el cual trabaja. Joaquin en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un lote de arboles de eucaliptos.  

Joaquin pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Joaquin agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Joaquin was born in the city of Lamay and is 50 years old. He lives in the same city where he was born, and this is also where he makes his living. He is a lumberjack and has a motorized saw to work with. At this time, Joaquin needs a loan to buy a lot of eucalyptus trees.

Joaquin belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay" communal bank, located in the province of Calca and department of Cusco, Peru.

Joaquin is grateful for and values this loan and promises to comply with his monthly repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy a lot of eucalyptus trees

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a conservative person who is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. Therefore, the man in the photo is her son.

Jehad is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Jehad is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do maintenance on her home.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 46 years old, from Migori and married to Paul. They have five children aged between 10 and 18 years old.

Annah operates a business selling maize cereal and has been doing it for the last 10 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 3,000. She is now taking her third loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of maize cereal. Her anticipated profits will be used to educate her children.

She dreams of doing a big maize cereal business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize cereal.

loans.name: Jamima

texts.en:
Jamima, age 26, has a food stall business in Yei, where she lives with her husband and their two children. Both the children are enrolled in school. She has operated her food stall business for five years.
 
Jamima heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this will be her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan in the amount of 3000 in order to purchase cassava flour and beans to offer for sale.

She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon, age 46, is the hard-working mother of seven children. The family lives in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She operates a hog-raising business and earns her living by selling to local butchers. Her husband is a farmer. The three eldest of their children are grown and married, and they have their own independent living around the province.

Nuon is requesting a loan in the amount of KHR 100,000, which she will use to renovate and expand her wooden piggery, buy additional piglets, and purchase pig feed. By ensuring the proper growth and nutrition of her pigs, she can sell them for a good price, thereby increasing her income and the family's well-being.

loans.use: to renovate and expand her wooden piggery, buy additional piglets, and purchase pig feed

loans.name: Kanario

texts.en:
Kanario is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya. She is aged 58 and married with five adult children. She has consistently practiced farming for 11 years and currently sells her produce of cabbages, potatoes and carrots to the local market and mainly the middlemen. Kanario manages her farm with the help of two farmhands.

Kanario has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into the poultry and dairy goat farming business at 60,000 KES and 20,000 KES, respectively. She hopes this will help her expand her cereals retail business that she runs alongside farming. Kanario adds she has settled for poultry and dairy goats that can give better yields even during harsh weather conditions.

She reiterates that poor climatic conditions remain the major challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy poultry chicks and dairy goats.

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es: Ximena de 28 años de edad vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena,  ciudad  localizada a orillas del mar Caribe y  segundo centro urbano en importancia de la Costa Caribe colombiana, después de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende alimentos, que inició solamente para trabajar durante los fines de semana, vendiendo entre sus vecinos sopa,  un caldo alimenticio, en el cual se han cocido vegetales o productos cárnicos.  Gradualmente su negocio fue creciendo y sus clientes empezaron a solicitarle  que trabajara  todos los días, por eso hoy  prepara comidas corrientes, dirigidas a un mercado que trabaja, a quien le vende su almuerzo todos los días de la semana. Su meta es lograr organizar su negocio y tener el reconocimiento de su clientela, que tiene un potencial crecimiento  y a quien necesita atender con la mejor calidad posible, ofreciéndole un ambiente confortable, aunque su gran desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará activos fijos como sillas mesas y menaje de cocina además de invertir en mayor volumen de materias primas, lo cual le representa un buen descuento en sus compras y esto es justamente el éxito  de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Ximena is 28, and lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena, located on the shores of the Caribbean. It is the second most important urban center on the Colombian Caribbean Coast, after the city of Barranquilla.

She has a business selling food, that she started in order to work only during the weekends, selling soup to her neighbors: a nutricious broth, in which  vegetables or meat products have been cooked. Gradually her business began to grow, and her customers started asking her to work every day. That is why she prepares a daily meal special, directed to her market of working people, to whom she sells her lunch every day of the week.

Her goal is to succeed in organizing her business better and to have a good customer base, which has a potential to grow. This is why she needs to serve her customers in the best way possible, and offer them a comfortable environment. 

However her great challenge is the lack of working capital to achieve this. It is why she is applying for her first credikiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy fixed assets such as tables and chairs, and kitchen items, and also to buy ingredients in greater volume; which means getting a good discount on her purchases. This is exactly why this investment will contribute to her success.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and kitchen items, and also to buy ingredients in greater volume.

loans.name: Hermes Gregorio

texts.es: Herme de 59 años de edad es casado, labora para Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 18 años. Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de comprar zinc y alfajillas  a un cuarto que construyo gracias al financiamiento anterior pero que no logro terminar porque no le dio el dinero, pues construyo un baño y levanto 3 paredes para hacer el cuarto que pretende terminar poniendole el techo y asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Herme, 59, is married and works for the municipal government of Juigalpa, where he has been a janitor for 18 years. He is requesting his fourth loan with the goal of buying metal roofing and lumber for a room he is constructing thanks to the previous financing he has received. However, he was not given enough money to complete the room, so he has built a bathroom and put up three walls but needs to install the roof in order to finish. This project will allow him to offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a roof

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
Rit is a hardworking mother of two children. She is 38 years old and married to a farmer, living together in a peaceful village in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. To add to her spouse's income, Rit raises hogs to fatten and breed in the backyard of her house, and then to sell to her frequent customer, the local butchers. Through her income, she allotted funds to save for emergency purposes and for her children’s future education as well.

Now she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan to buy 15 additional piglets, vitamins and feed for hog sustainability. She would like to ensure proper growth of her hogs so that she can offer them at a higher price. Consequently, Rit will be able to further stabilize and develop her hog raising business, leading to the betterment of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 piglets, vitamins and feed

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
From the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh City, Mrs. Lorn, 46, is a homemaker. She stays at home to care for her five children and holds a daily routine as well. Two of her children work in various jobs as garment factory workers and construction workers. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a domestic construction worker in the mobile place, earning an income of about USD $4 each day to support their financial expenses.

Mrs. Lorn is concerned that her husband faces difficulties in traveling to his workplace. He always travels to work by hiring a taxi or walking because he does not have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Mrs. Lorn has requested a loan for $1,500 to be used to buy a new motorcycle for her husband in order to have transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband in order to have transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Oeun is a 61-year-old married woman who is blessed with three children who are teenagers. She is a domestic rice farmer in Kompong Cham province. Her husband is a domestic construction foreman, who has employees to provide his service in and around his community. Recently, the couple will hold a wedding party for their child but they lack some money to make it make possible. That is why Mrs. Oeun is asking for her loan to add to her personal savings in order to hold on her child’s wedding party.

loans.use: to pay for their child's wedding party.

loans.name: Maria Erra

texts.en:
Maria Erra is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Maria Erra is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Maria Erra has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Maria Erra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Tukolani Group

texts.en:
Vumilia is in her early 30s and earns her living as a food vendor. She and her husband have one child who goes to school. She has been a food vendor for one year now and works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily. Through this business, she is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to utilize it by increasing her food stock and to start a new business that will involve selling fabrics door to door.  Her dream is one day to be able to own and operate a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tukolane," which has a total of 24 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. (One client is hidden behind the woman in the t-shirt marked "Bwin" in the photograph. Only her hand can be seen.)

loans.use: to increase her food stock and to buy fabrics to offer for sale

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 33 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es maestra panadera y tiene un pequeño horno en su domicilio. Ignacia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del horno.  

Ignacia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Ignacia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 33, and was born in the town of Lamay.  She lives in the town where she was born, and where she carries on her livelihood. She is a master baker and has a small oven in her home.  

On this occasion, Ignacia needs a loan in order to have maintenance done on her oven. Ignacia belongs to the "Virgencita de Fatima de Lamay" communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa, located in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru. 

Ignace appreciates and is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay her monthly installments.

loans.use: To have maintenance done on her oven.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 80 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él es jubilado del magisterio pero se dedica a la agricultura. Mariano en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.   

Mariano pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Mariano agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Mariano is 80, and was born in the town of Lamay. He lives in the town where he was born, and where he carries on his livelihood. He is a retired teacher, and now farms. On this occasion, Mariano needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Mariano belongs to the "Virgencita de Fátima de Lamay" communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa, located in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru.

Mariano appreciates and is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay his monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years. She is 40 years old, married, and has seven children. Three of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Hector de 56 años de edad vive en Soledad y se dedica a la fabricación de calzado desde que trabajó para una empresa productora y comercializadora y se retiró en el año 1985 para iniciar su aventura emprendedora comprando hormas y un motor con el cual se dedico a producir sandalias que vendía entre familiares y amigos. Muy pronto la calidad se su producto se hizo notoria al exhibir cada diseño en su propia casa y empezó a vender por docenas a clientes que tenían su propia clientela y así ha continuado trabajando.  Su sueño es tener mayor crecimiento en su taller, para contratar personal y generar empleos y así mismo tener un punto de exhibición exclusivo, pero su gran desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo para lograr su sueño y poder responder mucho mas a su creciente clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará pegante, cuero, tacones, plataformas y plásticos y adicionalmente reparará   su  máquina guarnecedora. El éxito de esta inversión radica, en que tendrá un nuevo capital de trabajo para compras de contado y en mayor volumen, con el que ganará descuentos y también su experiencia técnica, adquirida cuando fue empleado de uno de las marcas de mayor calidad de calzado en Colombia.
texts.en: Hector, 56, lives in Soledad and has a shoe-making business.  He used to work for a company that produced and sold shoes, but he retired from this position in 1985 so that he could start up his own venture.  He bought shoe lasts (molds) and a motor, with which he began making sandals that he would sell to his relatives and friends. Very soon people began to take note of the quality of his products.  He would display each design in his own home, and he started to sell by the dozens to customers who had their own clientele, and so in this way he has continued to work.  His dream is to have more growth in his workshop, so that he could hire workers and generate jobs.  In addition, he would like to have his own place where he could exclusively display his shoes.  However, his main challenge is that he lacks the working capital he needs to achieve his dreams and be able to respond to his rapidly growing customer base.  At this time, he is applying for a Kiva loan, and this will be the first time that he has had financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, he will buy glue, leather, heels, platforms and plastic, and he will also make some repairs to his shoe stitching machine.  He expects that this investment will be successful for two reasons.  First, with the loan he will have more working capital and so will be able to buy in cash and in greater volume, so that he will be able to get discounts. Second, he brings a lot of technical experience to the project, acquired when he was an employee of a company that makes one of the best quality brands of shoes in Colombia.

loans.use: to buy glue, leather, heels, platforms and plastic, and he will also make some repairs to his shoe stitching machine

loans.name: Yadira Jamileth

texts.es: Yadira Yamileth de 41 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos están estudiando, uno la universidad y el menor terminando la primaria; labora para la municipalidad como inspector ambiental desde hace 3 años. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de reparar su casita cambiandole el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, pues desea aprovechar el verano para hacer esta obra antes que el invierno entre.
texts.en: Yadira Yamileth, 41, is single. Her children are in school - one in college and the younger is finishing elementary school. She has worked for the city government as an environmental inspector for 3 years. She is asking for her second loan so that she can repair her small house, putting on a new roof because the current one is in bad condition and she wants to take advantage of the summer and do it before winter comes.

loans.use: to build steps and paint her home

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en:
Sam Oeurn, 62, is married and resides with her husband and a daughter in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over ten years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns approximately USD 3 per day in order to increase her family’s income. 

Sam Oeurn is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more cattle to breed in order to resell them for a profitable price when the cattle gain weight. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to resell for a profitable price when the cattle gain weight.

loans.name: Miurel Karina

texts.es: Miurel de 23 años de edad es soltera, trabaja en el Hospital Asuncion como despachadora de farmacia desde hace 3½ años. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de terminar el porche de su casa, pues le faltan algunos detalles en los protectores de hierro, ademas de ponerle el piso, porque solo esta embaldozado.Cabe señalar que anteriormente fue beneficiada con kiva para construir el porchecito de su casa y ahora desea terminar algunos detalles que dejo pendiente por falta de dinero
texts.en: Miurel, 23, is single. She has worked in the Asuncion Hospital as a pharmacy dispatcher for 3 1/2 years. She is asking for her third loan with the goal of finishing the porch of her house, since some details on the iron bars are left to do, as well as the floor installation, because it is only tiled. Previously, she benefited from Kiva for the construction of the little porch of her house, and now she wants to finish some details that she left undone due to lack of money.

loans.use: to complete porch construction

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal, 33, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a garment worker for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband works as a palm fruit harvester and earns approximately USD 5 per day.
 
Due to the difficulty with the family’s transportation, Sophal is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money from her transportation expenses to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a house to live separately from her mother.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат уже восемь лет как занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, у нее смешанный ассортимент товара. Ей 28 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки женских плащей. Мухаббат замужем.
texts.en:
Muhabbat has been engaged in trade for 8 years already. She has a point of sale at the market, where she has a mixed assortment of goods.
She is 28 years old. She takes a loan to purchase women's coats. Muhabbat is married.

loans.use: to purchase women's coats for reselling

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen de 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son aún dependientes de ella. Tiene 3 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos reciclados, negocio con el cual lleva 7 años. Comenzó con la idea de obtener mejores ingresos, ya que este negocio le resulta más rentable. También se dedica al servicio de limpieza desde hace 7 meses. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado comprarse una moto para facilitar el transporte de sus artefactos que da en venta. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos escolares de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos por alimentación y vestimenta. Su plan para el futuro es abrir una chatarrería y comprarse un par de motos. Ella piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de más artefactos usados para revenderlos a un mejor precio. Carmen pertenece al grupo de “El Arbolito”, el cual esta conformado por 7 personas, y  le pusieron dicho nombre porque el árbol “crece y da sus frutos”. Ella lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace un año.
texts.en: Carmen is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on her.  She has been with EDAPROSPO for 3 years and makes a living purchasing and selling recycled items, a business she has had for 7 years.  She started this business because it was profitable and she wanted to earn a better income.  She has also had a cleaning service for the past 7 months.  With much effort and work Carmen was able to purchase a motorcycle, and that makes it easier for her to transport the items she sells.  Right now her income is used to cover her children’s school expenses, while her husband takes care of the family’s food and clothing expenses.  Carmen’s plan for the future is to open a scrapyard and purchase several more motorcycles.  She is planning to use the loan to purchase more recycled items so she can resell them at a better price.  Carmen belongs to the “El Arbolito” [“The Little Tree”] group, which is made up of 7 members—they chose their name because the tree “grows and bears fruit”.  Carmen has been the group’s president for one year.

loans.use: to purchase recycled items to sell.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 41 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él es agricultor y tiene varias chacras en su domicilio donde siembra maíz. 

Maximo en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono, pesticidas y otras cosas más. 

Maximo pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Maximo agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Maximo was born in the city of Lamay and is 41 years old.  He lives and works in the city where he was born.  He is a farmer and has various small farms at his home where he plants corn.  Maximo needs a loan at this time to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other things.  Maximo belongs to the "Virgencita De Fatima De Lamay" communal bank of the Asociacion Arariwa, in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco, Peru.  Maximo is grateful for and values the loan and commits to making his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other things.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are still in school. 

Cecilia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 3,000 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Yina Aracelly

texts.es: Yïna de 33 años de edad trabaja para el MINSA de Juigalpa desde hace 15 años, como auxiliar de enfermera en el centro de salud. Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de terminar de reparar el techo de la casa, pues con el crédito anterior solo logro comprar una parte de los materiales, ademas desea alistar a sus hijos para el año escolar, asi como para pagar la matricula del curso de enfermeria que esta sacando.
texts.en:
Yina is 33, and has been working for MINSA (Ministry of Health) in Juigalpa for 15 years as a nursing assistant in the health center. 

She is applying for her eighth loan, with the aim of finishing repairs on the roof of her home, since with the previous loan she only managed to buy part of the materials. In addition, she wishes to enroll her children for the coming school year, as well as pay the registration fees for the nursing course she is taking.

loans.use: To replace her roof.

loans.name: Sonia Lorena

texts.es: Sonia  vivi en (libertad ecuador ). comenso su negocio con valor y temor porque ella invirtió poco para ver si funcionava el negocio.al ver que si resulto decidió agrandar su compra e invertir mas en su negocio. con esfuerzo y ganas decidió seguir con su negocio. A futuro ella quiere engrandar mucho mas su negocio y salir adelante con su familia. Con el préstamo quiere comprar( vitrinas, papeleria, cuadernos, plumas.
texts.en: Sonia lives in the city of Libertad.  She started her business with both courage and fear, and at first she only invested a little in her business to see if it would work.  Based on her initial results, she decided to increase her investment in her business.  With much effort and willpower she has kept going with her business.  In the future she wants to make her business much bigger and get ahead with her family.  Sonia will use the loan to purchase display cases, stationery, notebooks, and pens.

loans.use: to purchase display cases, stationery, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: La socia dio y giro total a su anterior empresa y ahora se dedica  la compra y venta de lenceria, ropa y accesorios para damas, la socia esta muy contenta de poder seguir trabajando y en especail con este nuevo rubro en su vida, ya eque ella disfruta mucho de comprar ropa y leceria fina para damas, ella es una mujer muy amable y tiene muchas amistades a las cuales les visita con sus nuevas ofertas y propuestas de ropas segun la temporada, ella en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ropa y de lenceria para damas.
texts.en: The partner gave her all and operated everything at her former business and nows works buying and selling lingerie, clothing and accessories for women.  The partner is very happy to be able to continue working and especially in this new area of her life, as she enjoys buying clothing and fine lingerie for women.  She is a very kind woman with many friends whom she visits with her new goods and clothing designs depending on the season.  She would like a loan at this time to invest in buying clothing and lingerie for women.

loans.use: to buy clothing and lingerie for women.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel  de 55 años de edad casado, labora para la municipalidad desde hace 22 años como Fiscal de proyectos. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar la vivienda de su familia construyendo una pared para tapia de la casa la que se encuentra ubicada en la Libertad,  y asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Manuel is 55 and married.  He has worked for the city for 22 years.  He is requesting his third loan with the objective of improving his family's home by constructing a wall outside of it so he can offer his family better living conditions.  Their home is located in Libertad.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Shohzoda

texts.ru: Шохзода проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 33 года. Она замужем. Шохзода более 15 лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственный продуктов. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Shohzoda lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 33 years old and married. Shohzoda has been engaged in planting agricultural products. She takes a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика жительница района Хамадони. Возраст, 43 года. Разведена. Имеет четверых детей. Образование у нее высшее. По специальности Малика работает 16 лет. Также она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и вышивкой. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Malika is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  Aged 43, she is divorced and has four children.  Malika has a higher education and has worked in her specialization for 16 years.   She also sews traditional dresses and embroiders.  She has been doing this work for three years.  She is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 41 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios de carros en un local alquilado en la ciudad antes mencionada. Marivel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, llantas, aceites, refrigerantes, filtros y otras cosas más. 

Marivel pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Marivel agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Marivel was born in the city of Lamay and is 41 years old.  She lives and works in the city where she was born.  She works selling spare parts and accessories for cars in a rented location in the aforementioned city.  Marivel needs a loan at this time to buy merchandise such as tires, oil, coolants, filters and other things.  Maribel belongs to the "Virgencita De Fatima De Lamay" communal bank of the Asociacion Arariwa, in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco, Peru.  Marivel is grateful for and values the loan, and commits to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as tires, oil, coolants, filters and other things.

loans.name: Dionisia Del Socorro

texts.es: Dionisia de 35 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Dionisia labora para la municipalidad como Auxiliar de presupuesto desde hace mas de 8 años. Esta solicitando  su  2do credito con el objetivo de  repellar la sala de su casa para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder darle a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida y que estos estudien para que sea personas de provecho.
texts.en: Dionisia is 35 and married.  She has 2 school-aged children.  Dionisia has worked for the city as a budget assistant for more than 8 years.  She is requesting her second loan with the objective of plastering the walls of her living room to give more comfort to her family.  She has the support of her husband, who takes on the home's expenses.  Her biggest dream is to be able to give her children better living conditions and that they study so they will benefit society.

loans.use: to plaster her living room walls.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Litein in South Rift Kenya and is aged 30 years old with 9 solid years in the farming business. She is currently producing milk for the local market. Farming is her main source of income but gets additional income from her teaching work in a local private school.

Joyce has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will increase her milk output and enable her to improve her family's living standards. She hopes her business will be much better in the future.

She laments of undeveloped markets locally and poor weather conditions as the challenges that farmers have to cope with.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Maybel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 17,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Maybel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Maybel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Abas

texts.en:
Abas is a 23 year old lady from Migori County and is married to Bonface and they have a daughter.

Abas operates a potato crisp production business and has been doing this for the last two years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 17,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to  buy a charcoal stove, bananas and potatoes. Her profits will be used to repay the loan.

Her dream is to become a leading crisp producer.

loans.use: To buy a charcoal stove, bananas and potatoes.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Juvy has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.
Juvy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Walter Maecelo

texts.es: WALTER DE 34 AÑOS VIVE  (LIBERTAD - ECUADOR) EL COMENZO TRABAJANDO CON UN AMIGO PESCANDO. LA MANERA DE VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS ES TRANSPORTARSE EN UN TRICICLO Y RECORRER EN EL PARA LA VENTA DE PESCADO. CON EZFUERSO Y VALOR EL REALIZA SU TRABAJO DIA A DIA A FUTURO QUIERE PONER SU NEGOCIO EN UL LUGAR ESTABLE. CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARA (PESCADO).
texts.en:
Walter is 34, and lives in Libertad, Ecuador. He started by fishing with a friend. 

He sells his food products by using a tricycle as transportation, and making his rounds in it selling fish. He is carrying out his work day after day, with effort and courage. In the future he wants to set up his business in a permanent place. He will use the loan to buy fish.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Juan Evers

texts.es:
Juan nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 23 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él tiene un taxi y brinda servicio interprovincial y cubre la ruta de Calca a Cusco y viceversa. 

Juan en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

Juan pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Juan agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Lamay and is 23 years old.  He lives and works in the city where he was born.  He owns a taxi and provides interprovincial service, covering the route from Calca to Cusco and vice versa.

Juan needs a loan at this time to do maintenance on his car.

Juan belongs to the "Virgencita De Fatima De Lamay" communal bank of the Asociacion Arariwa, in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Juan is grateful for and values the loan, and commits to making his monthly payments.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Asilbubu

texts.ru:
Асильбубу 60 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Асильбубу на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки дойной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Асильбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы, 3 теленка, 4 овцы и 10 кроликов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асильбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров, что позволит ей увеличить надои.  Доходы от кредита Асильбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Asilbubu is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  Starting her business with the purchase of a milking cow, Asilbubu has now been raising livestock for 15 years.  Thanks to her persistent work, today she has 2 cows, 3 calves, 4 sheep, and 10 rabbits.

With the goal of further developing her business, Asilbubu applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 soms (KGS) for the purchase of milking cows, which will allow her to increase her milk production.  Asilbubu is planning to invest the income from the loan in additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lourdes Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes es una mujer soltera que es madre de un pequeño de 10 años de edad, el cuál asiste a la escuela en el nivel primario. Esta pequeña familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar que con el transcurso de los últimos 5 años se ha desarrollado mucho económicamente. Para poder salir adelante ella se dedica a la venta de distintos productos para el hogar en su pequeña bodega.

Lourdes sabe que con el tipo de negocio que tiene necesita emplear todo su tiempo, debido a que sus clientes están constantemente visitándola por cualquier tipo de producto. Diariamente labora un promedio de 12 horas, tiempo en el que atiende a un promedio de 35 clientes, ella sabe que es vital el trato que le brinda a sus clientes y que es necesario siempre estar al pendiente de sus necesidades.

Actualmente ella desea poder realizar la compra de andamios y algunos anaqueles con la finalidad de continuar creciendo en su negocio, con esta nueva inversión desea poder hacer crecer su bodega e implementarla lo mejor posible, todo esto con la finalidad de tener un mini market al cabo de algún tiempo.
texts.en:
Señora Lourdes is a single mother with a 10-year-old son who is in elementary school.  This small family lives in the city of Ica, Peru, a place that has developed a lot economically in the last 5 years.  To be able to take care of her family, she sells various products for the home in her small grocery store.

Lourdes knows that with the type of business she has, she needs to dedicate all of her time to it because her customers are constantly visiting her for every type of product.  She works 12 hours a day, during which she attends to an average of 35 customers.  She knows that the way she treats her customers is vital, and it's necessary to always be aware of their needs.

She currently wants to buy scaffolding and some shelves to continue growing her business.  With this new investment, she hopes to be able to grow her store and to set it up in the best possible way.  Her goal is to have a mini-market after some time.

loans.use: to buy scaffolding and shelves.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 49 years old and married with 3 children. He sells plastic basins, plates and cups to earn a living. He has been in the business for 11 years and describes his customers as low income earners because they live in the slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 90,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastic basins, plates and cups for sale.

loans.use: To buy plastic basins, plates and cups for sale.

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus is a 31 year old man from Migori County and is married to Zarao and they don't have children though he supports his two brothers.

Linus runs the popular potato crisp production and has been doing this for the last three years making a monthly income of KES. 18,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy a stock of potatoes for crisp production. He will use the profits to the pay school fees for his brothers.

His dream is to open a branch in other nearby towns of Kisumu and also educate his siblings.

loans.use: To buy a stock of potatoes for crisp production.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 29 years old and married with three children.  She runs a grocery store to earn a living, she has been in this business for four years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.  

Since Jane joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to own a big grocery store in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy bananas, carrots, maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas, carrots, maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Yei.  She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years.  She is thirty years old, married and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Regina heard about BRAC South Sudan from her credit officer.   This loan will be her fourth loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 3,000 in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian nació en la ciudad de Lamay y tiene 43 años de edad, él vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él es policía en retiro pero ahora está trabajando como seguridad en una cadena de hoteles. Adrian en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su casa. 

Adrian pertenece al banco comunal “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú. 

Adrian agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Adrian is 43, and was born in the town of Lamay. He lives in the town where he was born, and where he has his livelihood. He is a retired policeman who nows works in security for a hotel chain. On this occasion, Adrian needs the loan to have maintenance done on his house. 

Adrian belongs to the “Virgencita De Fátima De Lamay” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, located in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru. 

Adrian appreciates and is thankful for the loan, and promises to pay his monthly installments.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 27-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He bears the responsibility of looking after his family and his desire is to educate his children through the university level. Paul used to ride a motorcycle for a living, and after saving enough income, was able to buy land on which he now farms. Paul's business challenge is unpredictable seasonal weather.

Paul is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to plant. His dream is to farm extensively.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to plant

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, 48, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sugarcane juice and breeding pigs for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying cattle to resale to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. In order to develop her family’s economy, Lan is requesting a loan of USD 800 to raise capital for her husband’s business of purchasing more cattle for resale. By doing this, her husband would make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to purchase timbers to cover her house’s walls as well.

loans.use: to raise capital in her husband's business of purchasing more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Frelly

texts.en:
Frelly is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Frelly has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Frelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Frelly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, sixty, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  He has been selling palm juice for over ten years, earning approximately three US dollars per day.  His wife is involved in breeding pigs to sell and earns about USD 3 per day.  Three of his children are employed in a garment factory.  They earn approximately USD 3 per day as well.  

In order to improve his family’s livelihood, Sam has requested a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fodder and sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell.  By doing so, he will be able to generate more income to support the family.  In the future, he would like to expand his pig farm and help his children get a bachelor’s degree.  Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger to provide convenient living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder and sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 42-year-old married man with two children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For the past five years he has been growing bananas on a commercial basis. Paul's business challenge is the current banana wilt that has affected his plantation and led to low yields this season.

Paul is requesting a loan to rehabilitate his plantation by buying mulch and planting new stems.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan and his wife have been engaged in animal breeding for more than 10 years. They raise five cows and two calves as well. The milk that is produced Vardan takes to the factory, providing for his family and paying for his daughter's education.
 
Vardan is 50 years old. He lives in Stepanavan and he has two adult children: a daughter and a son. His daughter is a student and his son lives in another country.   

Vardan intends to develop his farm so he needs a 500,000 AMD loan to buy three bull calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy three bull calves

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es: Eduardo compró materiales con los que elaboró nuevos diseños de sandalias. Su negocio ha dado un cambio desde que recibió su credikiva, porque ha podido cumplirle a todos los clientes. Su meta mas adelante es crecer y ampliar su negocio para dar empleo a muchos que lo necesitan. El envia su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva: " Gracias por el apoyo recibido y por la labor que realizan a nivel mundial. En la actuialidad está planeando un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina para exhibir su producción, y tambien invertirá en materiales para producir nuevos diseños de zapatos colegiales y modelos femeninos en general. Con esta ayuda el siente que cumplirá poco a poco sus metas y sueños propuestos para su familia y dice: "Gracias, Muchas Gracias:"
texts.en: Eduardo has bought materials with which he has created new designs for sandals.  His business has changed since he received his Kiva loan, because he was able to fulfill his obligations to all of his customers.  His goal later on is to grow his business in order to provide employment to many who need it.  He sends this message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the support received and for the work that you do worldwide".  He is now planning a new Kiva loan, with which he will buy a shop window to exhibit his products, and also invest in materials to produce new designs for shoes for schoolchildren and women's models in general.  With this help he feels that he will meet his goals and the dreams proposed by his family little by little and says: "Thank you, thank you very much".

loans.use: to buy a shop window to exhibit his products, and also invest in materials to produce new designs for shoes for schoolchildren and women's models in general.

loans.name: Naem

texts.en:
Naem is 50 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. For the past 20 years, Naem has been involved in breeding animals and selling nylon rope. She earns approximately 5 USD each day. Her husband is a construction worker who additionally buys and sells cattle to generate extra income for the family. 

Naem is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to purchase more nylon rope to sell and generate profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get their bachelors degrees. Moreover, Naem hopes to build a concrete house to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nylon rope to sell

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene de 38 años de edad es casada, labora para la municipalidad como afanadora en un CDI. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de repellar la parte de enfrente de su casa y si el dinero alcanza embaldozar la acera y la sala para asi brindarle mejor comodidad  a su familia. Expresa sentirse muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada, pues con los creditos a ido mejorando poco a poco su casita.
texts.en:
Marlene is 38, and married. She works for the municipality as a cleaner in a childcare center.
