57-year-old Anahit lives in Vanadzor. She has been running a sports shoes trading business over 10 years. Anahit operates her business from a small rented stall at a trade fair.  Her husband helps her in this occupation and thus they support their family.  They were also able to buy a car for their business and to organize their two children’s weddings.
  
Twice a month Anahit and her husband go to Yerevan where they visit wholesale markets and buy merchandise for their business. Anahit’s son also helps her as far as possible in her business and sometimes Anahit goes to Yerevan to do purchasing with him.
 
Anahit says that in the spring the demand for her products increases heavily, so she is seeking  a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of sports shoes to resell.

loans.use: buy sports shoes

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from Migcanaway, Tangub City.  Salvacion used her last loan to invest in the expansion of her business. She is now requesting a new loan to purchase more items to increase her product offering. She hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Brictor

texts.en: Brictor is 50 years old and blessed with six children, ages 22, 18, 13, 10, nine and seven. Brictor sells fruits and grocery goods, a business she started four years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. Brictor has requested a loan of KES.30,000 to purchase a stall to stock a variety of fruits to sell. The anticipated profit will aid her in educating her children, as well as buying additional stock for her business. Her dream is to one day own a plot of land and construct rental houses. This is Brictor's first loan.

loans.use: to buy a stall to stock a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jader Jose

texts.es: Jader habitante Colonia Talolinga, desde su pequeñez se ha dedicado a realizar actividades del campo en conjunto con su papa, como manejo de su inventario ganadero y tambien realizacion de actividades agicolas, establecimiento de cultivos de granos basicos y tuberculos,  hoy en dia trabaja por si solo ejerciendo las mismas actividades antes mencionadas, las que se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingreso para el bienestar de su estabilidad economica,  requiere de este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de 5 ternero de desarrollo actividad que le permitira incrementar el numero de su inventario ganadero, a corto plazo poder realizar una mejor comercializacion que le genere mayores ganancias, referencias en su localidad lo consideran como una persona responsable, de buenas culturas y ademas progresiva, espera ser beneficiado con este financiamiento para poder llevar a cabo su preyecto anhelado.
texts.en:
Jader lives in Colonia Talolinga; he’s been doing field work since he was little with his father like tending to livestock and also doing farming chores planting basic grains and tubers.  Today, he works for himself in the same kind of activities mentioned above which have become the main source of income for his family’s economic stability.

He needs this loan to buy five calves to raise that will allow him to increase his herd size and in the short run be able to make better sales that produce higher profits.  

References from his neighbors indicate that they consider him to be a responsible person with good habits and also progressive.  He hopes to be benefited with this loan in order to carry out his much wished for project.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La Sra. Sofía tiene 63 años y es casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de  22 años,   ella se dedica a la venta de comida que se encuentran en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sofía  utilizara este préstamo para la  compra de  sillas y mesas y también en la compra de víveres por mayor para su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su negocio y así bridar mayor comodidad a su clientes, La Sra. Sofía  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son en la venta de comida es  la competencia. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios n seguir mejorando su negocio ya que con el tiempo desea tener un restaurante grande para la venta de comida, ella se siente agradecida y feliz con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sofía is 63 years old, married and has a 22 year old son; she sells food in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone.  This loan will be her third cycle within the institution.  Sofía will use the loan to buy chairs and tables and also to buy foodstuffs at wholesale for her business.  The reason for asking for the loan is to expand the business and provide more comfort for her customers.  The challenge Sofía faces in her food selling business is competition.  She will use the benefits to continue improving her business because in time she’d like to have a large restaurant to sell food.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it’s provided.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and to buy foodstuffs at wholesale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 50-year old resident of Silanga, Tangub City. She provides her 4 children's needs from the little amount of PHP 8,000 she eans monthly from her own piggery business.  She has had this business for 5 years and uses it as an aid to the income earned from her husband.  

Nancy has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  She applied for a loan of PHP25,000 from GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Nancy wants to make expansions to her business one day.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Tao

texts.en:
Tao, 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation (motor taxi) business and earns about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are garment workers, earning approximately USD 6 per day. 

Tao wants to rebuild her present house.  Due to lack of funds, Tao is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to pay to construct her house. This loan will  enable her to have convenient living conditions for her family.  In the future, Tao would like to run a pig farm and help her children get bachelor degrees.  

With this loan, Tao hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and bigger to provide convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children -- three of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase more charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Ita Yvate Group

texts.es:
Ita Yvate se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá; gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Claudia contactó con la asesora para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedora y una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo del programa, dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y ayuda mutua.
Claudia, nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de bijouterie que ella misma hace, y que gracias a su creatividad tiene muy buena salida. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, perlas, lentejuelas y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir haciendo sus bijouterie.
texts.en:
"Itá Yvate" is the name of this fine group of women in the city of Itá. It was created thanks to the fact that the current chair, Claudia, contacted the program advisor to find out how the Enterprising Women Program worked. Once advised about the program, she managed to bring together 16 women who are now very happily in the fourth loan cycle in the program, in an atmosphere of cooperation and mutual help.

Claudia tells us that she sells jewelry that she makes herself, and that thanks to her creativity, she has very good sales. She defines herself as a very hard-working and enterprising woman who has a great desire to succeed, and to be able to help her family through her work.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy thread, needles, pearls, sequins, and other supplies she needs to be able to continue making her jewelry.

loans.use: To buy jewelry-making supplies.

loans.name: Nicole Aracely

texts.es:
Nicole es una joven emprendedora, soltera y sin hijos. Vive en la parroquia de "Abraham Calazacón" de "Santo Domingo" que es cantón y ciudad de la nueva "Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas", que era parroquia rural de Quito (capital del Ecuador),  se encuentra entre la costa y la sierra del país entre ciudades importantes; es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país por lo que tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Nicole desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares y accesorios de comunicación. Esto le a ayudado a ella a mantenerse. Lo empezó por iniciativa propia. Nicole quiere ahora crecer, y para ello necesita de un crédito que le permita invertir en mercadería y de esta manera tener mayor oferta para sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos.

Este es su primer crédito y está muy optimista. La evaluación crediticia por parte de Fundación Alternativa determinó que Nicole podrá cumplir con sus pagos. Además Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que intermediará entre Nicole y los prestamistas a nivel mundial le brindará apoyo y asistencia de tal manera que pueda crecer de una manera sostenible.
texts.en:
Nicole is a young, single entrepreneur; she has no children.  She lives in the Abraham Calazacón Parish in Santo Domingo which is a canton and new city in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province which used to be a rural parish in Quito (Capital of Ecuador).  It’s located between the coast and the country’s mountains between important cities.  It is the rainiest part of the country so it’s rich in water resources; its average temperature is 22°C.

For the last two years Nicole has been selling mobile phones and communications accessories.  This has helped her support herself.  She started it on her own initiative.  Now, Nicole wants to grow and needs a loan to do so to invest in merchandise to have a wider selection available for customers thus obtaining higher income.

This is her first loan and she’s very optimistic.  The credit evaluation on the part of Fundación Alternativa determined that Nicole will be able to make her payments.  Besides, Fundación Alternativa is the intermediary between Nicole and lenders worldwide that will provide assistance and support so that she can grow in a sustainable way.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Lonkisa

texts.en: Lonkisa is a mixed farmer in Narok where he practices wheat, maize and animal farming.  With this third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, he plans to purchase farm inputs for his farm.  The anticipated profits will be used to settle basic needs and pay school fees for his children. His future dream is to be financially stable and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children -- both of them are still in school. 

Jenifer heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase charcoal.   She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng, 34, is married and resides with her parents, her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years.  They have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Meng is requesting for a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will enable her to use the saved money from transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and is married to Job. They are blessed with six children, aged between 26 and 15 years.  Mary has been in her business for eight years and generates a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

Mary will be using this loan to purchase cereals to resell.  The anticipated profits will be used to expand her business.  This is her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan.  Her dream is to expand her business to higher levels.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
El señor Juvenal, tiene 41 años, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 9 y 10 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, reside en el Municipio de Olanchito departamento de Yoro.
Don juvenal trabajaba de albañil anteriormente pero hace 2 años se dedica al comercio, específicamente a la venta de productos alimenticios a través de una pulpería (venta de azúcar, arroz, frijoles, carne de res y de cerdo, salsa de tomate, manteca).
Con el propósito de surtir aun más su pulpería, ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras.
Él espera ofrecer a corto plazo a sus clientes productos lácteos (queso, mantequilla) con lo cual espera aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juvenal, 41, has three children who are 3, 9 and 10 years old.  He lives with his spouse in the town of Olanchito, Yoro Department.  

Juvenal used to work as a bricklayer but has been a merchant for the last two years, specifically selling foodstuffs in a grocery (sale of sugar, rice, beans, beef, pork tomato sauce, lard).  In order to better stock the grocery store he’s asked for a 12,000 lempira loan.  

He hopes in the short run to provide dairy product (cheese, butter) to his customers hoping to increase his income this way.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Aremia

texts.es:
Aremia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos en estudio, la señora estudio hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.

Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de queso, trabaja hace tres ciclos con Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 700.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de dos cajas de queso, lo compra de la localidad de Ayaviri y lo vende en la ciudad de Puno y Juliaca, trabaja sola en le negocio su esposo es agricultor.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener más capital y mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es  la facilidad del préstamo, la unión y intercambio con las socias.
texts.en:
Aremia is a member of the Apostle James Community Bank located in the district of Puacarcolla, province and department of Puno. She is 24 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has two children who study. She studied until the third year of secondary school. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used the money to invest in her cheese-selling business. She has been with the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles.

Now she is asking for a new loan of 700 nuevos soles, and will use the money to buy boxes of cheese in Ayaviri to sell in the cities of Puno and Juliaca. She works alone at her business and her husband is a farmer.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and improve her business. What she most likes about the community bank is the ease of the loan process, and the unity and communication amongst the members.

loans.use: buy boxes of cheese

loans.name: María Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 40 años, tiene 4 hijos de 12, 15,19 y 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo en el Municipio de la Másica, Atlántida.
Doña María con el apoyo de su esposo inicio la venta de productos alimenticios a través de una pulpería vendiendo alimentos de la canasta básica familiar y abarrotería en general.
Actualmente ha solicitado su primer préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, el que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotería para la venta.
Ella cree que administrando bien su préstamo lograra aumentar sus ventas y obtener una mejoría en sus ingresos, los cuales piensa destinar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and has four children who are 12, 15, 19 and 21 years old; she lives with her husband in the town of Másica, Atlántida.

María started selling foodstuffs with help from her husband through a grocery store selling basic staple items and groceries in general.

She is asking for her first, 10,000 lempira loan, to buy groceries to sell.  She believes that by administering her loan well she will succeed in increasing sales and earning improved income which she will target for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Eloida

texts.es:
Eloida tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 22, 18, 17, 15, 13, 11 años de edad,  y todos están estudiando, vive con su familia en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Doña Eloida la actividad que le genera los ingresos necesarios es la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Este negocio lo empezó motivada a ejercer sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene clientes por mayor porque le vende a los puestos de venta de comida de los alrededores. Manifiesta que el negocio le ha sido rentable porque ha logrado salir adelante generando buenas ganancias.  Ella dedica 10 horas diarias. 
Este es su séptimo préstamo con ODEF de 5,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en comprar maíz y leña para la elaboración de las tortillas para seguir vendiendo, para aumentar mis ingresos.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos en la educación necesario y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

.
texts.en:
Eloida, 49, is married and has six children who are 22, 18, 17, 15, 13 and 11 years of age; all are attending school.  She lives with her family in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

The activity that generates the necessary income for Eloida is making tortillas to sell.  She started the business motivated to earn her own income and help her husband with household expenses.  She has wholesale customers because she sells to food stands in the area.  She states that the business has been profitable because she’s managed to get ahead generating good profits.  She works ten hours daily.

This is her first ODEF loan.  It’s for 5000 lempiras that she will use to buy corn and firewood to make the tortillas to continue selling and increasing income.  Her goal is to continue working to support her children with necessary education and to give them a better quality of life.


.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, a 31-year-old married father of two children, has been keeping livestock to earn a living for three years, and employs two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Stephen has been able to pay school fees for his children, and hopes to buy more cows and goats in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy feeds for his cows and goats.

loans.use: to buy feeds for his cows and goats.

loans.name: Norlys Esther

texts.es: Norlys de 34 años de edad  es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 5 y 10 años respectivamente; ella se dedica a la actividad comercial, pues desde que inició su juventud tuvo su primera experiencia vendiendo verduras, para después cambiarla por la venta de cosméticos y prendas de plata, con la que finalmente se quedó porque le fue muy bien, pues tuvo una gran acogida entre su clientela. Con su negocio genera ingresos con los que apoya el bienestar de su hogar; su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, hasta convertirlo en un almacén donde ofrezca gran variedad de productos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una vitrina y mercancía para surtirla, con su adquisición planea hacer que su clientela se impacte, viendo muy de cerca muchos productos que ellos necesitan y muy pronto le compren y se conviertan en sus clientes. Su sueño de crecimiento es inagotable, pero la falta de capital de trabajo para responde a la demanda de su clientela es su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Norlys is 34 years old, she is married and has two children aged 5 and 10 respectively. She makes her living in retail, as from a young age she had her first experience of selling vegetables, she then moved on to selling cosmetics and silver jewelry where she ultimately remained as it was going well and she was well received by her customers. Through her business she generates an income to support her family's well-being. Her aim is to expand the business to the point of converting it into a store which offers a wide variety of products. 

At the moment, she is applying for her first Kiva loan, which is also the first loan that she has sought from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will buy a glass display case and merchandise to stock it. With this purchase, she hopes to impress potential customers as they can see many products they need up close, then buy it from her and become her customers. 

Her dreams of expansion are limitless, but the lack of working capital to respond to her customers' demands is her main challenge.

loans.use: to buy a glass display case and merchandise to stock it.

loans.name: Seferina Apolinar

texts.es:
Seferina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”, ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia  y Departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene seis hijos independientes.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Seferina está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado a Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, le sirvió para incrementar  el capital  de su negocio, el cual consiste en la compra y venta de ganados menores, entre ellos cordero y cerdo; con el tiempo su capital fue incrementando, de la misma manera su negocio mejoró, pues ahora no solo vende  animales menores  sino también se dedica a la venta de productos de la región y venta de gaseosas, galletas, golosinas y quesos.
La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/ 2,100.00 nuevo soles, préstamo  que le servirá para comprar 10 cajas de galletas, golosinas, gaseosas y animales para su engorde, para venderlos en las ferias de la comunidad, trabajo sola en el negocio. 
Su sueño es seguir operando con el negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría con sus compañeras, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Seferina is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” communal bank located in Paucarcolla District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 51 years old, a widow and has six independent children.  She has never attended school.

Seferina has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last five years.  She tells us that her first loan request to Manuela Ramos was for 300 new soles that she used to increase working capital for her business which consists in buying and selling small farm animals like sheep and pigs.  In time her capital increased gradually and the business improved the same way for now she not only sells small farm animals but also sells regional products and soft-drinks, cookies, snacks and cheese.

She will request a new, 2,100 new sol, loan to buy ten boxes of cookies, snacks, soft-drinks and animals to fatten up to then sell in the street markets in her community.  She works alone in the business.  Her dream is to stay in business.  What she likes about the communal bank is to share the joy with her fellow members, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of cookies, snacks, soft-drinks and animals to raise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco Comunal Santiago Apostol, vive en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos independientes, la señora no tiene estudios.

Es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  se dedica a la venta de ganados, leche, queso y productos de la región, su solicitud es por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar chanchos, pollos para luego venderlos.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir operando en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” communal bank.  She lives in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 51 years old, married and has 7 independent children.  She’s never attended school.

She is a new member who has recently started working with the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She sells cattle, milk, cheese and regional products.  Her request is for 500 new soles that she will use to buy piglets and chicks to sell later.  She works together with her husband.

Her dream for the future is to stay in business.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the ease of loans.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chicks.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Actualmente estudia en la universidad.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero con el que comprará una docenas de casacas, cinco colchas, ollas, la mercadería lo vende en la ciudad de Cusco (lunes y viernes).
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es terminar su carrera y hacer crecer el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el interés del préstamo, el ahorro.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank located in the district of Paucarcolla, province and department of Puno.  She is 23 years old, unmarried, and has one son.  Currently, she is studying at the university.  She has been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for two years.  Her first loan was for the sum of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles she invested the funds in her clothing sales business.

She is requesting a new loan for S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles to purchase one dozen coats, five bedspreads, and pots.  She sells this merchandise in Cusco on Mondays and Fridays.  Her dream for the future is to complete her degree and grow her business.  What she enjoys most about her communal bank are the interest rates on the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to purchase one dozen coats, five bedspreads, and pots.

loans.name: Tab

texts.en:
Tab is 30 years old.  He is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.   He has been running a public transportation service (motor taxi) and fattening cattle for over 10 years.  He earns approximately $4 per day and his wife, a rice farmer, earns about $2 per day. 

Because his present motorbike is too old, Tab is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a new motorbike to run his transportation business.  This purchase will enable him to attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, he would like to run a poultry farm and help his children study to earn bachelors degrees.  Moreover, he hopes to build a new wooden house to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for his motor taxi business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, a 41-year-old married mother of four children, resides in Kapalaran, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Rosa owns farmland, and has been planting and harvesting rice for sale to make a living for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of PHP 7,000.

In 2010, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation and is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lina Herolina

texts.es:
Lina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”, ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla provincia  y Departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.
Trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos dsde hace cuatro meses, nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos fue de S/. 500. 00 nuevo soles, le sirvió para incrementar  el capital  de su negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de artesanías como títeres.
La señora solicitar un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo  que le servirá para comprar  6 kilos de lanas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de títeres. La mercadería lo vende en la localidad de Juliaca y en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos. 
Su sueño es seguir operando con el negocio. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” communal bank located in Paucarcolla District in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 33 years old, single and has two children.  She studied up to third grade in secondary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last four months.  She tells us that the first loan requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement was for 500 new soles that she used to increase working capital in her business which consists in selling crafts like puppet marionettes.

She will ask for a new, 300 new sol, loan to buy six kilos of wool yarn in assorted colors to make the puppets.  She sells her merchandise in Juliaca and her children help her with the business.  Her dream is to stay in business.  What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality, the responsibility and the savings.

loans.use: to buy six kilos of wool yarn in assorted colors.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  ubicado en el distrito Paucarcolla, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos independientes, la señora estudio educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, su primer préstamo fue por S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir como casacas, peluches, sombrillas, sabana, colcha, etc.

Actualmente solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/. 2,300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra una docena de peluches, sabanas, casacas y buzos, la mercadería la vende en la ciudad de Cusco.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo y a veces su hija.

Su sueño para el futuro  es seguir trabajando un tiempo más en el negocio y poner su tienda de abarrotes.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el bajo interés, el ahorro y su ganancia
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” communal bank located in Paucarcolla District in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 61 years old, married and has four independent children.  She went to secondary school.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last four months.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she used in her business selling articles of clothing like jackets, stuffed toys, umbrellas, sheets, bedspreads, etc.

At present, she’s asking for a new loan in the amount of 2,300 new soles to buy a dozen stuffed toys, sheets, jackets and sweatshirts; she sells her merchandise in the city of Cusco.  Her husband and sometimes her daughter help her with the business.  

Her dream for the future is to continue working for more time in the business and to open a grocery store.  What she likes best about the communal bank is the low interest rate, the savings and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy one dozen stuffed toys, sheets, jackets and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Don Marcial  habitante de comarca la Tigra, durante su existencia su principal fuente de trabajo ha sido el campo, en la actualidad su unidad de produccion conforma su principal fuente de ingreso, mediante la realizacion de cultivos agricolas y el manejo de su pequeño inventario ganadero, lo que le ha permitido subsidiar sus necesidades y mantener la estabilidad economica en su nucleo familiar, todas estas actividades antes mencionadas las lleva a cabo en conjunto con su señora y sus hijos, requiere de este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de un semental, actividad de gran oportunidad para poder mejorar la produccion y reproduccion de su hato bovino, referencias en su localidad lo consideran como una persona responsable, trabajador, espera ser beneficiado con este financiamiento para poder llevar a cabo su proyecto su meta planificada.
texts.en:
Marcial lives in the Tigra region. During his lifetime, farming has been his main source of work. Now his farm represents his main source of income, through crop production and the management of a small cattle herd. This has allowed him to pay for his needs, and maintain his family's financial stability. He carries out all these activities jointly with his wife and children.

He needs this loan to purchase a breeding bull, as this is a great opportunity to improve the production and breeding performance of his cattle herd. Local people who provided his references consider him a responsible, hard-working individual. 

He hopes to be granted this loan, so that he can carry out his project and achieve his planned goal.

loans.use: To buy a breeding bull.

loans.name: Koinet

texts.en: Koinet is a 25-year-old single man who supports two people. He is a farmer in the town of Narok where he specializes in mixed and maize farming, as well as purchasing fattening animals for resale. He has been in the business for the last three years and earns a monthly income of KES 17,000. With a third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD he plans to prepare his farm and buy farm inputs and fertilizers to enhance his crop yields. His profits will be used to support the business. His future plan is to expand his business, have better living standards and grow the economy.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animals for fattening.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has three children.  She is 38 years old and lives in Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  

Jocelyn owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting and harvesting rice to sell in order to earn a living.  She has been in this business for eight years and earns 4,000 PHP each month.  She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP in order to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow.  In 2010, Jocelyn became a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC.  

In the future, Jocelyn's plan is to save money in order to support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to grow.

loans.name: Saroth

texts.en:
Saroth is 30 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She and her husband have been selling vegetables for over seven years, earning approximately $6 per day.   

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Saroth is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to raise capital for her business in order to purchase more vegetables to sell.  By doing so, she would generate greater profit to support the family.  

In the future, she would like to use the additional profit to expand her business and help her children study to earn bachelors degrees.  Moreover, she hopes to build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
La señora Rocío tiene 39 años y es madre de 02 niños. Ella es integrante de la alcancía comunal “Dios es Amor y mi Guía”. Esta alcancía está conformada por 09 integrantes desde hace más de dos años y medio. La señora Rocío se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace más de 08 años, con esto ha podido cuidar y darles una adecuada educación a sus hijos; en el futuro ella quiere implementar una bodega. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de más productos de belleza que serán vendidos en esta temporada, con esto ella podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos y brindarles una mayor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
La señora Rocío es la primera mujer de la derecha, lleva puesto un polo de color morado. En la parte inferior izquierda está la señora patricia.
texts.en:
This group of female entrepreneurs has one purpose -- to be successful in their businesses so that she can always move forward.  They are members of the Communal Bank "Dios es Amor y Mi Guia" (God is Love and My Guide).  The group consists of nine members and they have been together for more than 2½ years.  They all possess the initiative to change and make progress.  

One such member is Sra. Roció.  She is 39 years old and the mother of two young children.  Roció has been selling beauty products for more than eight years and it has enabled her to support her household and provide her children with the care and education that they need.  In the future, she would like to open a grocery store so that she can be near her home all the time.  With this recent loan, she will buy more beauty products that are in season.  

Just like Sra. Roció, the other members of the Communal Bank "Dios es Amor y Mi Guia" are enterprising and determined women whose only objective is to succeed for themselves and the welfare of their families. Sra. Patricia is pictured on the lower left.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y  tiene 03 hijos, la señora realizo estudios de educación  primaria.

Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, en la fabricación de prendas de vestir y tejidos como ropones, pantalones, suéter.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 900.00 nuevos soles, dinero con la que comprará materiales como 5 kilos de lana para la confección de ropas para niños y producción de tejidos, la señora cuenta que la mercadería lo vende en la plaza dominical y san José de la localidad de Juliaca, trabaja sola su esposo se dedica al transporte.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es tener su propia tienda de artesanía  y educar a sus hijos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, charlas y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” (The Messengers) communal bank in the Juliaca district, San Román province, Puno department.  She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children.  She has an elementary school education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 500 soles.  She used the money to increase the capital in her business.  She makes clothing and knitwear like gowns, pants, and sweaters. 

She is requesting a new loan for 900 soles to buy materials like five kilos of wool to make children’s clothes and for her knitting production.  She says that she sells the merchandise at the Plaza Dominical and San José in Juliaca.  She works alone; her husband works in transportation. 

Her dream for the future is to have her own handicrafts store and to educate her children.

What she likes the most about her communal bank are the meetings, the talks, and  the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: to buy materials like five kilos of wool.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old and is blessed with six children aged 18 years, 16 years, 11 years, 10 years, seven years and three months.  She sells building materials, a business she ventured into five years ago, and earns a monthly income of 75,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES in order to purchase sand (one lorry), dust (half a lorry) and six tons of wood.  The profit she earns from this business will help her educate her children and purchase additional stock for her business.  This is her first loan

Her dream is to own her own plot of land one day and to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase sand, dust and six tons of wood.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, a 41-year-old mother of five children, all of school age, is married to a farmer and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental Philippines. Maricel has been harvesting rice to sell locally for six years, and this is the primary source of income for the family. Every month, she earns Php 3000, enough to cover day-to-day expenses for the family's needs.

In 2009, Maricel joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance to help improve her business activities. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 6000 from the cooperative to purchase manure/fertilizer to ensure a good rice harvest. Maricel is planning to expand her business, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase manure/fertilizer to ensure a good rice harvest.

loans.name: Dayana Guadalupe

texts.es: Dayana labora como Auxiliar de Enfermeria en el Hospital Jacinto Henandez en la zona urbana,  Solicita su 2do crèdito para comprar materiales de construcciòn para hacer la cocina, es una joven muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, ha demostrado ser una mujer con buen comportamiento en el municipio, su compañero de vida labora como auxiliar de enfermeria, ambos son muy trabajadores y responsables con los pagos de sus deudas, aun no tiene hijos por lo que gana solamente es suplir sus necesidades basicas, ella sueña con seguir estudiando ya que es bueno seguirse actualizando en lo que respecta a la medicina, gozar de salud y que su linda familia permanezca unida
texts.en:
Dayana works as a nurse's aide at the Jacinto Henandez Hospital in the urban area. She is a applying for her second loan, in order to buy construction materials for building a kitchen. She is a young woman who is well-loved by her co-workers, and who has shown good work performance at the municipality. 

Her life partner works as a nurse's aide. Both are very hard-working and responsible in paying their debts. She still has no children, so what she earns is only to meet their basic needs.  

She dreams about continuing to study, as it is a good thing to keep updating oneself about medicine. She also hopes to enjoy good health, and that her beautiful family remain close-knit.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Eusebia

texts.es: Maria de 59 años vive( machala ecuador) empezo su negocio a raíz de que su esposo enfermo. Maria con mucho esfuerzo y valor decidió salir adelante co su negocio y de esa manera poder alludar a mejorar a su esposo de la enfermedad. A futuro ella quiere terminar de contruir su vivienda y que su hija termine sus estudios. Con el préstamo va a comprar frutas, carnes para hacer comida para la venta.
texts.en: María, 59, lives in Machala, Ecuador.  She started her business when her husband became ill.  With much effort and valor she decided to get ahead with her business to be able to help her husband recover from his illness.  In future she wants to finish building her house and that her daughter completes her schooling.  She will use the loan to buy fruit and meat to prepare food to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit and meat.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy more items like slippers, pants, blouses and other clothing to sell to customers.

Fe has been in this business for 5 years. Fe earns more income from selling dried fish and vegetables.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to put up another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers, pants, blouses and other clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Saparkul

texts.ru:
Сапаркул родилась в 1963 году в селе Жерге-Тал, Тянь-Шанского района,  Нарынской области (север Кыргызстана). В 1982 году, окончив училище, она начала простым рабочим в заводе в городе Бишкек, где проработала около трех лет. В 1985 году вышла замуж, переехала к мужу  в село Темир-Канат Тонского района и устроилась на работу в Быткомбинат Тонского района. К сожалению, заработной платы  ее и мужа не хватало, чтобы покрыть все расходы семьи. Отработав до 1991года и накопив 5,000 сом, Сапаркул решила начать свой бизнес в животноводстве, купив одну дойную корову. 

 Начиная заниматься сельским хозяйством, Сапаркул еще тогда поставила цель  - большое хозяйство и достойное и благоприятное будущее  ее детей.  Будучи по характеру целеустремленной, терпеливой, трудолюбивой  женщиной, Сапаркул смогла добиться поставленных целей - в данное время у нее имеется в собственности 3 голов коров, 20 голов овец и 1голова лошади, небольшая кошара и орошаемый земельный участок с площадью 2,10га, получая ежегодно урожай клевера, пшеницы, ячменя и картофеля. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сапаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120, 000 сом  (KGS) с целью увеличить поголовье скота для откорма и дальнейшей реализации. Доходы от кредита Сапаркул планирует вложить в увеличение площади кошары.
texts.en:
Saparkul was born in 1963 in the town of Zherge-Tal in the Tian-Shan district of the Naryn province (in northern Kyrgyzstan). In 1982 after finishing school she began as a simple laborer in a factory in Bishkek, where she worked for three years. In 1985 she married, moved with her husband to the town of Temir-Kanat in the Tong district and found work in the Tong district's manufacturing plant. Unfortunately her and her husband's salaries were not enough to cover the family's expenses. After working until 1991 and having saved up 5,000 som, Saparkul decided to begin her own livestock business, and bought a milk cow. 

Even as she just began to work in agriculture, Saparkul set a goal: to have a large farm and a well deserved and bright future for her children. Being by nature a purposeful, patient, hardworking woman, Saparkul was able to reach her goals. At this time she has 3 head of cattle, 20 head of sheep and one horse, an smallish sheepyard and 2.10 hectares of irrigated land from which she harvests clover, wheat, barley and potatoes annually. 

In order to further develop her business, Saparkul came to the Bai-Tushum and Partners company for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan, with the goal of increasing the number of livestock she has for raising and later sale. Saparkul plans to use profit from the loan to invest in expanding the sheep yard.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Bexy Lucia

texts.es: Bexy de 57 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil). Ella anteriormente vendia panes pero para ella era muy trabajoso . asi que decidió vender dulces y moños. Hace cuatro años se deesempeña a hacer este trabajo. con esfuerzo trabaja todos los días. A futuro ella desea tener su negocio en su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (material para su casa y asi mejorar el local que quiere para darle una mejor atencion a sus clientes).
texts.en: Bexy, 57, lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil.  She used to sell bread but it was too much work so she decided to sell candy and ribbons.  She’s been doing this work for four hears now and works hard every day.  In the future she wants to have a business at home.  She will use the loan to buy materials for her house in order to improve the locale she wants to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Mamadou Abdoul

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou  Abdoul est un commis de salle dans un hôtel  de la place. Et il a choisi son métier de pâtissier  par amour. Les aspects les plus intéressants  pour lui de son travail sont les rencontres avec des   personnes intéressantes  et les services qu’il rend aux gens. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis septembre 2009. Il sollicite un  crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour le complément de son épargne, il envisage payer et  acquérir un terrain dans son village natal.
texts.en: Mr Mamadou  Abdoul is a housekeeper in a local hotel. He also works as a pastry chef out of love for the trade.  For him, the most interesting parts of his job are his encounters with interesting people and the service that he provides. He has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's local divisions since September 2009. He is seeking a 500 000 frs loan in order to boost his savings, so that he may buy a plot of land in his place of birth.

loans.use: To boost his savings in order to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 5 children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising.  Sonia is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is married with 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felisa is 44-years-old and has 4 children who are in school.

Felisa has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Felisa has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Felisa would like to save money to have another business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.
